childrenYtVideo.title: React Hooks - useState and useEffect - Frontend Topics
childrenYtVideo.description:
After react's conf we're all pretty excited with the hooks API. Today we're going to see how to use the most basic ones, useState & useEffect. 

Can we finally get rid of classes ? What do you think ? 

Docs: https://reactjs.org/docs/hooks-intro.html

Sophie & Dan video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V-QO-KO90iQ

--- Follow Me ---
Twitter: https://twitter.com/alancampora
Github: https://github.com/alancampora

childrenYtVideo.title: React Custom Hooks - Frontend Topics
childrenYtVideo.description:
Building your own Hooks lets you extract component logic into reusable functions. The idea of this video, is to show how powerful custom hooks are, creating an usePagination hook.

Hooks lessons code: https://github.com/alancampora/frontend-topics-hooks

React docs: https://reactjs.org/docs/hooks-custom.html

childrenYtVideo.title: React Render Props - Frontend Topics
childrenYtVideo.description:
Render prop refers to a technique for sharing code between React components using a prop whose value is a function. 
Let's code a Toggle component to see how this works!

Code example: https://codesandbox.io/s/738yy6ojqq

React docs: https://reactjs.org/docs/render-props.html

childrenYtVideo.title: React Higher Order Component (HOC) - Frontend Topics!
childrenYtVideo.description:
Higher-order component is a technique in React for reusing component logic. HOCs are not part of the React API, per se. They are a pattern that emerges from Reactâ€™s compositional nature.

Code here: https://codesandbox.io/s/vvv94qnx25

React Docs: https://reactjs.org/docs/higher-order-components.html

childrenYtVideo.title: React Children as Render Prop - Frontend Topics
childrenYtVideo.description:
Render prop is a common pattern for sharing logic. Last time we saw how to do it using named props. Today we'll see how to use the children as a render prop.

Code example: https://codesandbox.io/s/13p9o158r3

childrenYtVideo.title: Quick JS Tips - Tagged Template Literals
childrenYtVideo.description:
A tagged function allows to change the output of template literals.

It will receive two parameters an array with the plains strings and other array with the values.

Going trough the array of strings we can concatenate each string with its styled value. In this case we use a bold red style.

Returning the result we see an undefined.

To avoid it we use the or flag on the value, and now the highlight tag function works!
